word: H3363 - יָקַע - yâqaʻ - yaw-kah' - Be alienated

sections.paragraph: to be dislocated, to be alienated
a) (Qal) to be dislocated, to be torn away, to be alienated
1) to execute slowly (by exposure or impalation)

ஆங்கில மூலம் / Original in English: A primitive root; properly to sever oneself, that is, (by implication) to be dislocated; figuratively to abandon; causatively to impale (and thus allow to drop to pieces by rotting): - be alienated, depart, hang (up), be out of joint.
